title: Trump Administration Begins Criminal Inquiry Into Minnesota Leaders
summary: The Justice Department’s investigation is a major escalation in the state-federal battle over the conduct of immigration agents in Minneapolis.

title: Judge Restricts Immigration Agents’ Actions Toward Minnesota Protesters
summary: A federal judge ordered agents not to retaliate against people “engaging in peaceful and unobstructive protest activity” in the state and not to stop drivers who are not “forcibly obstructing” officers.

title: The People of Minneapolis vs. ICE: A Street-Level View
summary: An intense cat-and-mouse game is putting enraged locals face-to-face with heavily armed agents.

title: Video Analysis of ICE Shooting Sheds Light on Contested Moments
summary: Newly available videos and existing footage synchronized and assessed by The Times provide a frame-by-frame look at how an ICE officer ended up shooting and killing a motorist in Minneapolis.

title: How Wall Street Turned Its Back on Climate Change
summary: Six years after the financial industry pledged to use trillions to fight climate change and reshape finance, its efforts have largely collapsed.

title: A Trump Veto Leaves Republicans in Colorado Parched and Bewildered
summary: The first veto of the president’s second term killed legislation that would have brought clean water to some of the most conservative parts of the state. Residents wonder why.

title: Black Women Turn to One Another as Their Career Paths Suddenly Recede
summary: Black female professionals have seen a steep drop in employment over the last year. They are turning to each other for pep talks and résumé advice.

title: Trump Has Machado’s Nobel Prize, but Neither Got What They Really Wanted
summary: President Trump has María Corina Machado’s medal, but he is not recognized as the prize laureate. Ms. Machado did not win Mr. Trump’s endorsement to become Venezuela’s president.

title: Despite Maduro’s Capture, Venezuelan Exiles Realize They’re Not Going Home Soon
summary: Spain is home to the biggest collection of Venezuelan emigrants outside the Americas. Many cheered the capture of Nicolás Maduro, but are now adapting to the fact that his allies remain in charge.

title: Can Cuba Survive Without Venezuela’s Oil?
summary: President Trump stopped Venezuelan oil shipments to Cuba, and experts say disaster looms. Oil fuels its electric grid and without alternative supplies the country will plunge into extended darkness.

title: Iran’s Supreme Leader, Unbending Over Time
summary: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has built his 37-year rule on uncompromising repression. His answer to the current protests is no different.

title: Iran’s Protests: What to Know About the Unrest and Death Toll
summary: The nationwide demonstrations that have roiled Iran for weeks appear to have been largely quelled after a brutal government crackdown.

title: Before Criticizing Pro-Hamas Chants, Mamdani Sought Jewish Leaders’ Input
summary: The outreach by Mayor Zohran Mamdani’s team has demonstrated how the mayor is taking care to not inflame tensions on either side of the Israel-Gaza war.

title: One Year In, Trump’s Attack on American Justice is Accelerating
summary: One year into the president’s second term, America risks losing a central feature of our democracy: that we are a country ruled by laws, not by the whims of one man.

title: How War With China Begins
summary: Even more likely than an all-out invasion of Taiwan may be “gray zone” pressures, such as cutting internet cables.

title: Prize Fight
summary: In the run-up to the Oscar nominations, a chat with a reporter who has followed every twist and turn of the race.

title: Inside the Doctors Without Borders Clinics That Israel Is Closing in Gaza
summary: The aid group has refused to comply with new Israeli rules restricting speech and demanding information on staff. Patients are stunned. “I need this place,” says one.

title: No Link Between Acetaminophen in Pregnancy and Autism, a New Study Finds
summary: The review looked at more than three dozen studies and found no evidence that acetaminophen increased the risk of neurodevelopmental disorders in children.

title: Some U.Va. Board Members Asked to Resign as Gov. Abigail Spanberger Takes Power
summary: After months of upheaval at the state’s flagship university, a new Democratic governor appeared ready to shake up the school’s leadership.

title: Syria’s President Affirms Kurds’ Rights, in Overture to the Minority
summary: President Ahmed al-Sharaa’s announcement on Friday came after days of fighting between the government and Kurdish forces. On Saturday, those forces began withdrawing from a flashpoint east of Aleppo.
